intro: Conophytum wettsteinii subsp. ruschii, commonly known as the "Cape snowball," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, triangular leaves that store water. The plant produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers during the winter months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
